alert.note: Alert for Doddridge; Pleasants; Tyler (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 8:42AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from earlier heavy rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of northern West Virginia, including the following counties, Doddridge, Pleasants and Tyler. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Middle Island Creek continues to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 837 AM EST, the automated gauge on Middle Island Creek near Middlebourne showed the creek remained above flood stage with minor flooding likely occurring. The automated gauge on Middle Island Creek near Little, WV, continued to quickly rise toward flood stage, and flooding may begin there shortly. - Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... St. Marys, Middlebourne, Alma, Arvilla, Point Lookout, Lima and Canton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
